values.text: I didn't understand. You can try rephrasing.
Can you reword your statement? I'm not understanding.
I didn't get your meaning.

Business is the productive activity that your company carries out. Examples of business: 
- Retail
- Food
- Agriculture
- Beauty
- Transport (Reel, deliveries)
Monthly billing is the sum of all amounts earned in the month.
You can check your company's earnings for the past month in your notes and add them up, so you'll be able to know your company's gross sales in one month.
Iâ€™ll ask you some questions about your business.
CNPJ stands for National Register of Legal Entities. This document is the equivalent of the CPF (Individual Taxpayer Registration) for companies, that is: for legal entities.
To apply for credit, you must have no credit restrictions.
Would you like to take a health assessment of your company?

Your company's health rating is an indication of how well your company is financially. It is necessary to know the health of the company to get credit.
To calculate health, write "I want to know the health of my company".

OK! You told me the following information:

You are in the *$business* segment, 
Your credit purpose is $credit_purpose.

Could you confirm me this? Type "yes" or "no".

Business is the productive activity that your company does. Examples of projects:
- Retail
- Foods
- Farming
- Beauty
- Truck

Credit is the "ability to borrow money or access goods or services with the understanding that one will repay or return those resources at a later time." 
Microcredit is  "the lending of small amounts of money at low interest to new businesses."

Can you specify what exactly you did not understand? You can say any of the following: "business", "annual billing", "fixed costs", "variable costs", company costs", "microcredit", or "monthly invoicing", "microcredit course", "SEBRAE", or "SEBRAE course".
You can show your health score to a loan officer for advice.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Thank you! A loan officer will review your information and get back to you as soon as possible.
Ok... Let's start again!
You can contact the unit that offers credit in your area and show your health business index.
Would you like to take a health assessment of your company?

Your company's health rating is an indication of how well your company is financially. It is necessary to know the health of the company to get credit.
To calculate health, write "I want to know the health of my company".
Monthly costs are all your company's expenses, such as rent, inventory, raw materials, debt installments.
You can check your company's expenses for the past month in your notes and add them up, so you'll be able to know your company's costs in a month.

CNAE consists of a code composed of 7 digits that will identify the economic activity carried out by a business.
These are the most common CNAEs:
- lalala
- lululu
- lelele
You can also consult your CNAE on this website.
Your business refers to what your business sells or provides. If you sell cakes, you could say that business is "I sell food". If you make pants, you could say "I make clothes"

Go to the Federal Government website (https://www.gov.br/empresas-e-negocios/pt-br/empreendedor/servicos-para-mei/declaracao-anual-de-faturamento) to make DASN-SIMEI. It is the obligation of the MEI to make this statement once a year.
Monthly invoice ...
Variable costs are those that vary proportionally according...
Your monthly invoice is the price sum of the purchases made.

Credit is the "ability to borrow money or access goods or services with the understanding that one will repay or return those resources at a later time." Microcredit is  "the lending of small amounts of money at low interest to new businesses." A loan is amount of money that has been lent, with the understanding that it will be repaid.
How can I help you?
Thanks. With the data you provided it was possible to calculate your company health index.
Your company costs is the sum of expenses like rent, stock, supplies, etc.
Thank you for the contact! I hope I helped you.
SEBRAE is a non-profit in Brazil. Here is their website - https://www.sebrae.com.br/sites/PortalSebrae, and this is the course link...
